author: Staff Reporter
text:
The link between the mind and music took centre stage at a retrospective and tribute session to the late Oliver Sacks, a neurologist and writer, on Sunday.

Ennapadam S. Krishnamoorthy, Founder of Neurokrish, and president elect of the International Neuropsychiatric Association, read some of the works of Oliver Sacks where he speaks about the interface between music, epilepsy and emotion.

Quoting some of the thoughts of Darwin, Spencer and Rousseau on music and evolution, Dr. Krishnamoorthy introduced the audience to the concept of ‘musicophilia.’ “Many artists such as Vincent Van Gogh had bursts of creativity,” he said, while illustrating examples of other creative minds who underwent a a moment of transformation. He spoke on the relation of ‘sudden musicophilia’ with seizures and said Oliver Sacks pointed out studies showed that people had the tendency to become hyper-musical after seizures.
title: Music and the mind
